data.text: Then all Israel came together to David at Hebron and said, “Here we are, your own flesh and blood.

Even in times past,11:2 Or For some time while Saul was king, you were the one who led Israel out and brought them back. And the LORD your God said, ‘You will shepherd My people Israel, and you will be ruler over them.’”

So all the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, where David made a covenant with them before the LORD. And they anointed him king over Israel, according to the word of the LORD through Samuel.
Then David and all the Israelites marched to Jerusalem (that is, Jebus), where the Jebusites inhabited the land.
The people of Jebus said to David, “You will never get in here.”
Now David had said, “Whoever is the first to strike down a Jebusite will become chief commander.”
So David took up residence in the fortress; that is why it was called the City of David.
He built up the city around it, from the supporting terraces 11:8 Hebrew the Millo to the surrounding wall, while Joab restored the rest of the city.
And David became greater and greater, for the LORD of Hosts was with him.
Now these were the chiefs of David’s mighty men, who, together with all Israel, bolstered and strengthened his kingdom, according to the word of the LORD concerning Israel.
This is the list of David’s mighty men:
Next in command was Eleazar son of Dodo 11:12 Dodo is a variant of Dodai; see 1 Chronicles 27:4. the Ahohite, one of the three mighty men.
He was with David at Pas-dammim when the Philistines gathered there for battle. At the place with a field full of barley, the troops fled from the Philistines.

But Eleazar and David stationed themselves 11:14 Literally But they stationed themselves in the middle of the field and defended it. They struck down the Philistines, and the LORD brought about a great victory.
Three of the thirty chief men went down to David, to the rock at the cave of Adullam, while a company of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.
At that time David was in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was at Bethlehem.
David longed for water and said, “Oh, that someone would get me a drink of water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem!”
So the Three broke through the Philistine camp, drew water from the well at the gate of Bethlehem, and brought it back to David. But he refused to drink it; instead, he poured it out to the LORD,
saying, “Far be it from me, my God, to do this! How can I drink the blood of these men who risked their lives?” Because they had brought it at the risk of their lives, David refused to drink it.

Now Abishai, the brother of Joab, was chief of the Three,11:20 Hebrew; Syriac the Thirty; also in verse 21 and he lifted his spear against three hundred men, killed them, and won a name along with the Three.
He was doubly honored above the Three, and he became their commander, even though he was not included among the Three.

And Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a man of valor from Kabzeel, a man of many exploits. He struck down two champions of Moab,11:22 Or two sons of Ariel of Moab and on a snowy day he went down into a pit and killed a lion.

He also killed an Egyptian, a huge man five cubits tall.11:23 5 cubits is approximately 7 feet 6 inches or 229 centimeters tall. Although the Egyptian had a spear like a weaver’s beam in his hand, Benaiah went against him with a club, snatched the spear from his hand, and killed the Egyptian with his own spear.
These were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada, who won a name alongside the three mighty men.
He was most honored among the Thirty, but he did not become one of the Three. And David appointed him over his guard.
Now these were the mighty men:
Shammoth the Harorite,11:27 Shammoth the Harorite is a variant of Shammah the Harodite; see 2 Samuel 23:25.
Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,
Sibbecai the Hushathite,
Maharai the Netophathite,
Ithai 11:31 Ithai is a variant of Ittai; see 2 Samuel 23:29. son of Ribai from Gibeah of the Benjamites,
Hurai 11:32 Hurai is a variant of Hiddai; see 2 Samuel 23:30. from the brooks 11:32 Or from the ravines of Gaash,
Azmaveth the Baharumite,11:33 Baharumite is a variant of Barhumite; see 2 Samuel 23:31.
the sons of Hashem 11:34 Hashem is a variant of Jashen; see LXX and 2 Samuel 23:32. the Gizonite,
Ahiam son of Sachar 11:35 Sachar is a variant of Sharar; see 2 Samuel 23:33. the Hararite,
Hepher the Mecherathite,
Hezro the Carmelite,
Joel the brother of Nathan,
Zelek the Ammonite,
Ira the Ithrite,
Uriah the Hittite,
Adina son of Shiza the Reubenite, chief of the Reubenites, and the thirty with him,
Hanan son of Maacah,
Uzzia the Ashterathite,
Jediael son of Shimri and his brother Joha the Tizite,
Eliel the Mahavite,
Eliel, Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
